intro: Trichosanthes wallichiana subsp. subrosea, commonly known as the pink-flowered bitter melon, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and yellow flowers that are often tinged with pink. Its fruits are typically elongated and have a bitter taste, similar to other members of the genus. The subspecies subrosea is distinguished by its pale pink floral hues, setting it apart from other Trichosanthes species.
